question: In the movies, when you beat up the neighborhood bully; you suppose to live happily ever after. But around here; that's when all the drama begins...
answer: Craig! Craig! Off yo' ass and on yo' feet; this ain't the time to beat your meat!

question: I'll be out in about 35-40 minutes!
answer: Hurry up; today is Fri-day! And we gotta hit the high-way!

question: Soon as my pops found out what Debo said to Ezal, he wanted me to move with my uncle and little cousin in Rancho Cucamonga. Til' things calm down, or Debo went back to prison. Whichever comes first.
answer: Craig! Let's go! I don't wanna hit that traffic.

question: Here I come!
answer: Well bring yo' ass on...

question: What's the matter?
answer: I fell in some mud. Now hurry up!

question: I didn't wanna leave my neighborhood at all. Especially my homeboy Smokey. But he went to rehab last week. I know I'mma miss him...
answer: Craig! Get out the car, boy! This the rematch!

question: Daddy, punch it!
answer: You know I'mma find you! You can run ya' can't hide!

question: You fake ass Suge Knight!
answer: That nigga worst than them damn pit bulldogs or something! That's why moving wit'cha Uncle Elroy and Cousin Day-Day is the best thing for you right now.

question: Ya'll making me look like a punk.
answer: It ain't about being a punk, son. It's about this...

question: What's that smell?
answer: Must be your upper lip, 'cause I don't smell nothing.

question: I do.
answer: What it smell like?

question: Smells like you didn't fall in no mud.
answer: I gotta get'em fixed. They don't roll down.

question: All damn.
answer: Just hold your breath. Nice neighborhood, huh?

question: It's alright.
answer: 18-years of chasing dogs; and my lazy ass brother hits the lotto his first time playing. I still can't figure that one out.

question: Why they got to have the loudest house on the block!
answer: Ah, son, don't be no hater. You know your uncle ain't got no taste. Just don't let him rub off on you.

question: You coming in?
answer: No, I'mma go on to work. I don't wanna hear Elroy's mouth. Now listen to me, Craig. It's gonna be different living over here. Don't let your uncle and your cousin get you into no shit. Understand?

question: Hey, Debo, heard you running from a ass- whippin'?
answer: Naw, it ain't like that.

question: If you see that boy again, bite off his ear off like Mike Tyson.
answer: Alright, I'll remember that.

question: Thanks, Unc.
answer: You know it's been over a year since we kicked it last? Up at the family reunion.

question: I know, that's when Uncle Elroy cussed out everybody, and threw up in Aunt Faye's backseat.
answer: Yep. I forgot about him cussin' out everybody. Damn that was fun.

question: I know, we had a good time. But ever since you guys moved out here, it seems like we've lost touch.
answer: I know; this a long way from Watts. But what I like about living out here is that you don't hear no helicopters, no sirens, no drive-by's, no nothing. Just peace and quiet. Listen.

question: Who is that?
answer: Joker, he just got out of the pen. Li'l Joker, he just got out of Youth Authority. And Baby Joker, he just got out of Juvenile Hall.

question: They ever let you hit the switches on that Cadillac?
answer: Naw, them dudes is assholes. Especially that dog - Cheeco. Watch this little ass, he's sneaky. Plus, I got something better than a Cadillac.

question: This you?
answer: Yeah, that's me. Just a little somethin' somethin' I picked up.

question: Must be nice. I wish we won the lottery. Come up on a million dollars like ya'll.
answer: Man, after taxes, lawyer fees, and paying off my daddy's bad credit, we didn't end up with a million. We bought this house and I spent the rest on this. It's the bomb, huh?

question: Hi, Day-Day!
answer: Hi, Mulan.

question: Fuck you, Day-Day. Who's ya boy?
answer: This my cousin, Craig. He just moved out here from L.A. Craig, this is Miss Ho.

question: My name is Miss Ho Kym. Day-Day just trying to be a smart ass. Nice to meet you, Craig. Are you 'bout it, 'bout it?
answer: Excuse me?

question: I said...are you 'bout it, 'bout it -- rowdy, rowdy?
answer: Yeah, I'm 'bout it.

question: Well, then, it's all good. Yo, Day-Day, something is going down with those Mexicans across the street? I've been seeing a lot of activity.
answer: What kind of activity?

question: Strange activity. I think they running drugs off Tijuana. Day-Day don't believe me.
answer: How do you know for sure?

question: I know everything, playboy. Don't hate, congratulate.
answer: I don't have time, Miss Ho, I'll see you later.

question: Man, this a cool house.
answer: Thanks, I just wish my mother had a chance to see it.

question: Yeah.
answer: Go on and make yourself at home. I'mma go get dressed for work.

question: Oh, yeah, where you work at?
answer: Pinky's Records and Disc in the shopping center. I'mma talk to my boss and see if he got a little position for you. 'Cause you been unemployed for a long time now, Craig.

question: You know, I'mma be your new auntie. We can keep it all in the family if you want to.
answer: Okay, okay, that's enough. Go put on some damn clothes.

question: Elroy.
answer: Suga. Go ahead and get us something to smoke on.

question: Nice to meet you.
answer: Man, that girl's gonna kill me one day. Viagra ain't working. My back keep going out... she don't never get enough. But check this out. I got to lay some ground rules. Your my family and I love you. You're welcome to anything you want in my home. But I don't wanna catch you in the refrigerator or in my Suga bowl... you feel me knocking?

question: Yeah.
answer: Well, let me in.

question: Uncle Elroy, who's that girl by Day-Day's car?
answer: Oh, that's D'Wana. His ex. Day-Day, the crazy bitch is back!

question: Aw, naw. Girl, you supposed to be 1000 feet from my house. What you doing over here?
answer: What it look like I'm doing? You can't quit me, I'm pregnant!

question: That ain't my baby!
answer: I got your bitch right here.

question: Awwwww.... Awwwww....
answer: I expect you to return all phone calls and take me to lunch today. I'll be back out here on my break. Nobody quits me.

question: Help him to his feet. Let's get him to the bathroom.
answer: Hold on. What you doing?

question: Wet your eyes, boy. Stay in there for about 20 minutes.
answer: 20 minutes?

question: Yeah, 20 minutes. Trust me. I've been pepper sprayed nine times. 20 minutes. Yeah, you gotta have a little money to live out here, Craig. I never thought I'd be the kinda nigga to move to the suburbs. But as soon as I got my check, I was gone. Paid 230 thousand dollars cash on this house.
answer: You paid cash?

question: Cash money. They wasn't gonna stick me with no 30-year payment plan. That's for suckas. They got my daddy like that for a Cadillac years ago. I got the only house on the block that's paid for. That's why I'm the king around here.
answer: It's cool, but where's the water?

question: Don't need water. We didn't have no pool in the projects...so none of us swim.
answer: Y'all never use it?

question: Never... But me and Suga can get real nasty in that Jacuzzi, though.
answer: That's okay, Unc. I can't swim, either.

question: I be damned.
answer: Where did Craig move to?

question: I don't know, Debo.
answer: What you say?

question: He moved out to Rancho Cucamonga with his cousin Day-Day.
answer: Rancho Cucamonga?

question: Yeah.
answer: Get on.

question: Man, we can't ride to Rancho Cucamonga on that.
answer: Get on!

question: You straight?
answer: Yeah, I'm alright. Is my face still orange to you?

question: Just a little.
answer: I can't taste nothing.

question: What's the matter with your girlfriend?
answer: Man, it's a long story. I met D'Wana three months ago. She had a little pudge in her stomach but I didn't pay it no attention. Come to find out, she six months pregnant. Saying I'm the daddy!

question: What?
answer: Yeah, I broke up with her two Fridays ago and she's been harassing me ever since. She don't care about the restraining order or nothing.

question: Restraining order? Where the hell you meet this girl?
answer: I went back to Watts to sell my old car and met her on the way. Worst day of my life.

question: Damn, you got a stalker.
answer: That ain't the worst part. Her little sister, Baby D. She's the one that gets real physical. But I got a restraining order on her, too.

question: You got a restraining order on a little girl named Baby D?
answer: You don't know Baby D.

question: Who is that?
answer: That's the sister.

question: Yo know what? I'm starting to like Rancho Cucamonga.
answer: I know what 'cha thinking. I thought the same thing. But it can't happen.

question: Why?
answer: Because, it's been a little tension between us ever since they got out the joint and ran their momma crazy. And I'm just trying to keep the peace. We moved out here to get away from that shit.

question: Yeah, it's bad. And that scratch make it ugly.
answer: Alright, alright... I see what you talking about.

question: Hold up, Day-Day.
answer: Let it go.

question: Hey! Hey!
answer: Karla.

question: Craig and Karla, damn that sound pretty good together. Where you going?
answer: To the Cucamonga shopping center.

question: Oh yeah, why you walking?
answer: My brothers won't give me a ride.

question: Look at my roof.
answer: Why not? She was cool with it.

question: So.
answer: What you mean, so?

question: Now I'mma show you the real "Puff Daddy."
answer: Suga.

question: Negro, what the hell you doing to my woman?
answer: I don't know!

question: Passed out? Can't hang, huh? Boy, I knew you was a lightweight. Passed out on one funky ass blunt. They don't make 'em like they used to, baby.
answer: Mr. Nasty time?

question: Mr. Nasty time. But take it easy on me, girl.
answer: Craig, you ain't the only lightweight around here.

question: Delivery!
answer: Hold on.

question: Delivery!
answer: I said hold on!

question: Could you hurry up, please... it's kinda hot out here.
answer: Can I help you?

question: Nice house. Didn't expect you to answer. You must be one of those entertainers. What team you play for?
answer: I don't play for no team.

question: Come on, jerky, you can tell me. Got a white wife, huh? Blonde bombshell type. Remember what happen to O.J... what team do you play for? You're not related to the Jacksons, are you?
answer: Naw, I play for the Chocamunga Cracker Killers. You want tickets?

question: Okay, buddy. Don't send your entourage out here to do a 187 on me. It's just a certified mail delivery.
answer: What is it?

question: Delinquent Property Tax Notice... I hope the Cracker Killers pay well 'cause if not, back to the ghetto you go. Wife stays here, of course.
answer: Oh damn. Uncle Elroy...Uncle Elroy?

question: We gotta stop or something, man. My ass is hurting. This handlebar is hard.
answer: Shut up! He still eats here every day! Here's the plan. You gonna call over there and say you have a very urgent message for Mr. William Jones.

question: What urgent message?
answer: If you shut up I'll tell you. The urgent message is...Drop everything! Craig is in trouble. Come quick, don't call.

question: That ain't gonna work.
answer: Just do it.

question: I don't know the number.
answer: It's on the outside of the building, now pick the phone up!

question: Hello...Yeah, I got an urgent message for a nigga named Mr. Willie Jones.
answer: William.

question: Yeah, I got a urgent message for a customer named William Jones. Drop everything, Craig is in trouble. Come quick. Don't try to call.
answer: Let's go.

question: You too big.
answer: Keep pushing.

question: I can't get jiggy with this shit. Where is the damn manager?
answer: Sir, the manager stepped out for a moment. I'm currently running the store. Can I see the CD?

question: No, give me my damn money back. Right now, and I don't have no damn receipt neither.
answer: Okay, sir...but where's the cover?

question: I don't have no damn cover.
answer: I can't give you your damn money back on this.

question: Bullshit! I'll go postal in this mothafucka!
answer: Well, you gonna have to go postal then.

question: I'm sorry! Don't hit me! Don't hit me.
answer: ...and if you come back, it's gonna be worse.

question: Yeah, it was. How you get up here?
answer: I walked.

question: You walked?
answer: Yeah, ya'll got a notice today. It came certified mail.

question: Hello, remember me?
answer: Hell yeah, I remember you.

question: I'm sorry for what my brother did this morning. They're assholes.
answer: It's cool. You ain't got to apologize for your brothers. They're big boys.

question: I just wanted to give you this.
answer: Most definitely.

question: Baby'D, you're not going to catch me as usual. So what can we do to end it this time? What you want? Another Big Pun CD? 'Cause I gotta get back to work.
answer: Okay, I know what I want this time.

question: Anything you need.
answer: Yo' cousin, Craig. Hook us up.

question: That's it?
answer: Just tell him to come over here and talk to me.

question: And I can go free?
answer: Go, fo' I change my mind.

question: Bummer, huh? And Friday is suppose to be a kick-ass day.
answer: Yeah it is...the best day before the weekend.

question: That's fuckin' poetic, Craig.
answer: What's the green stuff poking out?

question: That's cron-don, sir. My mom hates for me to smoke, so she made me bud-brownies. Wanna bite?
answer: Naw, I already ate.

question: Come on, Day, try it. For moms.
answer: It ain't a bong but, wa-la!

question: Wo!
answer: Hey.

question: Sorry, bro, reflexes. How did you do that?
answer: Black magic.

question: Don't move or I'll blow your head smooth off.
answer: I ain't trying to rob you...

question: Shut up! Fo' I pump this Glock in yo' ass! What did you do wit Day-Day and Roach?
answer: Man, Day-Day is my people!

question: I said shut up! Now who sent you?
answer: Nobody!

question: I gotta think of a plan to get this money before tomorrow.
answer: You could sell your Beamer.

question: I don't know. I hope Craig got a good idea. We gotta ask him when he comes out. Let's go and clean up before Pinky gets here.
answer: Maybe you can ask him to loan you the money.

question: Yoooo, that's it. You ain't as dumb as I think you are, Roach.
answer: I know.

question: Debo! Debo!
answer: What?

question: I can't feel my legs no more.
answer: Me neither. How far is Rancho Cucamonga?

question: It's something in that hydraulic pump.
answer: Yeah, air.

question: Naw. I bet'cha it's something better than air.
answer: How you know? It could be anything.

question: It is easy. You know why? 'Cause they're not expecting it. Now, Roach, you gotta occupy Cheeco. Long enough for me and Day-Day to take a good look.
answer: Dude, dogs hate me. I don't know why. Me and K-9's just don't get along.

question: Well get along with this one. Go ahead of us. Don't get seen and don't let that mutt out of your sight.
answer: Fuck, what's his name?

question: Cheeco.
answer: Here, Cheeco. Chee-co, here boy. That's a good boy.

question: Look at those tig-ole-bitties
answer: You go first.

question: Naw, you go first.
answer: You go first.

question: No.
answer: Day-Day, if you don't hop that fence I'mma throw you over.

question: I ain't scared of you. We ain't little no more.
answer: What?

question: I hope to God that dog is happy.
answer: Me too.

question: No, keep working.
answer: Yo, man fuck that shit. Do it later. It's Friday, time to party, SA.

question: Close the door.
answer: Not until you come party with us, man.

question: What you see?
answer: That pump was full of money. I saw where they put it. Stay right here, I'mma climb in and go get it.

question: Wait here? So Cheeco can bite my ass off? Tell me where it is I'll do it.
answer: No, man, just wait.

question: What are you doing?
answer: Huh?

question: What are you doing here?
answer: I hope you don't think I'm crazy, but I just had to come in here and show you I ain't scared of yo' punk ass brothers...and you wouldn't have be scared of 'em neither if you had a man like me in yo' life.

question: What?? So you snuck in my room to tell me that?
answer: Yes I did. Excuse me.

question: Oh shit.
answer: ...like I was saying. A guy like me, and a dog like you, don't need this bullshit. We need to be in Maui renting jet ski to fat funks in flower shirts. You feel me, C?

question: Roach...Roach, come on.
answer: Where's Craig?

question: He's inside the house?
answer: Why did he go in the house?

question: You did all this for me?
answer: Most of it. I just hate to see you in this situation.

question: Thanks for noticing. It used ta be peaceful before they got out. Took over the house and caused my mother's nervous breakdown.
answer: Why didn't she put'em out?

question: Easier said than done. We saved up to get away from them, but they followed us.
answer: I'm sorry to hear that.

question: I thought you came up here to see me.
answer: I did. Is that door locked?

question: It's locked.
answer: Make sure.

question: You so nervous, I already locked this door.
answer: I got my cousin Day-Day waiting for me.

question: So what? Let's make'em wait.
answer: I be damn.

question: Don't fuckin' move.
answer: What's wrong with you, fool. Stop kicking their door. They might think we the police.

question: What the fuck you want?
answer: Uh...um...I mean uh, can we borrow a cup of sugar?

question: What?! This look like a 7-11 or something? Get the fuck outta here!
answer: Alright, no problem. We gone.

question: I got your message. Where's Craig?
answer: I don't know, I didn't leave you no damn message!

question: You didn't call the Sandwich Joint with a urgent message?
answer: Hell naw, Willie. Them fleas and tics must be sucking on yo' brain!

question: Somebody left me a message. Well where's Craig and Day-Day?
answer: I don't know. Suga, go ask Miss Ho Kym if she seen them.

question: Look, man, this is a big misunderstanding. All we wanted to do is borrow some sugar.
answer: And some rolling papers.

question: ...and some rolling papers, that's it. We didn't mean to mess up y'all get together or nothing. How y'all doing? That's good. My name's Day-Day and this is my friend, Roach.
answer: Hey.

question: Keep your mouth shut.
answer: Hey, what's going on?

question: Nothing. What you want?
answer: Are you going to take me to see Mom?

question: Take your car.
answer: 'Take your car?'

question: Yeah, and hurry up.
answer: Okay.

question: Ezal! Ezal!
answer: Huh?

question: We must be here 'cause we stopped.
answer: Good, let's get out.

question: Hey, how you get out of here.
answer: I don't know.

question: Wait a minute! I live across the street! Yeah. Paid cash.
answer: They the ones you want.

question: When my back gets better I'mma beat the black off you, Day-Day.
answer: I know. I'm sorry.

question: Sorry, my ass.
answer: Elroy, what happen?

question: I threw my back, again.
answer: Aw, no lovin' tonight?

question: Naw, baby, no lovin' tonight.
answer: Come on, baby, let's go in the house.

question: Hey, guys, I'm outta here.
answer: Thanks for the help.

question: Hey, man, the pleasure's all mine. Thanks for the dog, and the money. Maybe my dad won't kick my ass tonight.
answer: Call me.

question: All done. Stand up.
answer: Hey, that George Jefferson shit works. Thanks, Miss Kym.

question: I can't accept.
answer: You better take this money.
